headline: Iceland Men‚Äôs Football Coach Resigns
body: Heimir Hallgr√≠msson announced this morning his decision to step down as coach of the Iceland men‚Äôs national football team,¬†R√öV¬†reports. He explained the decision at a press conference at 11.00am this morning. Heimir was appointed as assistant coach when Lars Lagerb√§ck took over the men‚Äôs team in 2011. He became co-head with Lars in 2014, leading the team to the UEFA Euro Championship quarter-finals in 2016. Heimir then took over as the team‚Äôs only head coach, leading it to qualify for the World Cup for the first time in it‚Äôs history. Heimir says he has worked well with everyone involved in the national men‚Äôs team. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really proud and it‚Äôs a privilege to be able to leave the situation the way it is today,‚Äù he stated. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great to say how much more professional everything has become than it was. We have a very well-defined work environment.‚Äù ‚ÄúMaybe then the question arises: then why are you leaving if everything is so great?‚Äù Heimur remarked. ‚ÄúIf I were to continue, I would probably continue with the same focus, the same emphases, and at some point the motivation would fade, fatigue would come.‚Äù Heimir added that the team‚Äôs success is not attributable to just one person, and that there were too many individuals responsible to thank each by name. His next career move is yet to be decided, Heimir says, adding that he had received inquiries from both national and regional teams. Although he is interested in applying his skills outside of Iceland, Heimir says the time has not yet come to make a move abroad.

headline: French Fans Celebrate World Cup Win in Reykjav√≠k
body: The atmosphere was lively at Ing√≥lfstorg square in Reykjav√≠k yesterday, where an international crowd of hundreds gathered to watch the 2018 FIFA World Cup final between France and Croatia,¬†R√öV¬†reports. A little rain did not seem to bother the crowd, which followed along with the game enthusiastically. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs incredible. There‚Äôs a lot of pressure,‚Äù said one French viewer during the second half. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt believe that maybe in 20 minutes we‚Äôre going to win this World Cup[‚Ä¶] We‚Äôre just praying.‚Äù The gathering included a considerable number of Frenchmen, who joyfully celebrated their team‚Äôs second-ever World Cup victory, 20 years after the first. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs definitely awesome to be here in Iceland, and to win against Croatia,‚Äù said one French fan after the game, adding that he was only eight years old when France won their first World Cup in 1998. ‚ÄúIt was really stressful, but really amazing,‚Äù said another supporter, before being interrupted by a screaming fan.

headline: Aron Einar Renews Contract with Cardiff City
body: Aron Einar Gunnarsson, captain of the Icelandic men‚Äôs national football team, renewed his contract with the Welsh football club Cardiff City,¬†R√öV¬†reports. His new contract will be valid until summer 2019. Aron Einar is Cardiff City‚Äôs longest-serving player. He‚Äôs played 243 games with the Bluebirds since he first signed with the club in 2011. He‚Äôs scored 24 goals in that time. According to¬†an announcement¬†on the team website, Aron Einar is enthusiastic about the contract saying, ‚ÄúI always wanted to stay‚Ä¶Even though I didn‚Äôt say much in the news, I just wanted to do my job on the pitch.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt was tough work to get back, ready to represent my country at the World Cup, and for Cardiff City.‚Äù Aron Einar continued. ‚ÄúNow, signing this deal has been my number one priority and I can‚Äôt wait to meet back up with the boys‚Ä¶My little boy was born in Cardiff and I‚Äôve been through a lot with this Club and the fans. I just can‚Äôt wait to pull on the strip again to represent the capital of Wales in the Premier League.‚Äù

headline: Thelma Lind Breaks Thirty-Six-Year-Old Record for Discus Throw
body: Thelma Lind Kristj√°nsd√≥ttir broke the Icelandic national record for women‚Äôs discus throw,¬†R√öV¬†reports. The previous national record had remained unbeaten for 36 years. Thelma Lind set the new record at a throwing event in Borgarnes on Thursday. She threw a discus 54.69 meters [179.4 feet]. This not only broke her own previous personal best‚Äî52.80 meters [173.2 feet]‚Äîbut also Iceland‚Äôs previous national record of 53.86 meters [176.7 feet], which was set by Gu√∞r√∫n Ing√≥lfsd√≥ttir in 1982.

headline: To Russia With Love (the short version)
body: September 6, 2013. It‚Äôs a warm fall evening in Bern, and Iceland squares up against a much-fancied Switzerland side in a World Cup qualifying match for. Iceland, led by Swedish coach Lars L√§gerback and his assistant, Heimir Hallgr√≠msson, have performed admirably so far in qualification. The dream of playing in fabled Maracan√£ stadium in Rio de Janeiro, the home of football in Brazil, is still distant, however. After an unexpected J√≥hann Berg Gu√∞mundsson opener, the Swiss team appears to be a number too big for the Icelandic players, as Iceland find themselves 4-1 down 54 minutes in. After a quickfire Icelandic equalizer, J√≥hann Berg Gu√∞mundsson steps up as he scores two breathtaking goals to draw the Icelanders level and complete his hat-trick ‚Äì the first one that an Icelander has ever scored in a competitive match. The image of the Icelandic team celebrating still lingers in people‚Äôs memories. That night in Bern gave both the nation and the team a newfound belief ‚Äì and Iceland hasn‚Äôt looked back since. Five years later, J√≥hann Berg is gearing up for the World Cup tournament in Russia. Although the surroundings will be different, the Luzhniki stadium in Moscow will be the setting of the same spectacle as the sandy beaches of Brazil promised some years back. The Icelandic team came so close in 2013, losing a play-off matchup against Croatia. The Croatians wait again this time around, as they have been drawn with Iceland in a group. J√≥hann Berg is riding high into to the tournament, as he enjoyed a fantastic season with unfancied outfit Burnley in the English Premier League. He was voted into the ESPN Team of the year for players outside England‚Äôs top six and has provided 8 assists along with goals against stalwarts such as Liverpool and Manchester City. If anyone is ready for the World Cup, it‚Äôs J√≥hann Berg Gu√∞mundsson. We picked J√≥hann‚Äôs brain on the upcoming World Cup, beating England at the EURO 2016, and his Counter-Strike skills. J√≥i Bern and playoff heartbreak After the hat-trick in Bern, J√≥hann Berg received the apt nickname J√≥hann Bern. ‚ÄúThat night in Bern helped the team immensely. We saw how good we could really become. It was one massive step in the process of us going to the World Cup. It was a magnificent night for Icelanders as well as me personally. I will always look back fondly on that night.‚Äù The dream of qualifying for Brazil 2014 ended abruptly, however, in a two-legged playoff against Croatia. At the time, many Icelanders felt that they had lost their one and only chance and the players struggled with the defeat. ‚ÄúIt was difficult to recover from that blow. There were many who believed this was the closest we would ever come to qualifying for the World Cup. What helped us immensely was to recover by qualifying for the EURO 2016. Then we managed, incredibly, to seal our ticket to the World Cup by coming in 1st place in a group with four teams who played at the EURO 2016.‚Äù World Cup fever Iceland is the smallest nation ever to reach a World Cup tournament, so Icelanders are eagerly waiting for the matches in Russia this summer. Qualifying for the World Cup is way bigger than we realize, I think. In a few years, we will look back on these achievements and realize how great they are. I‚Äôm just trying to enjoy the moment while it lasts.‚Äù He also recognises the pressure they‚Äôre under, as the team was the darling of the EURO 2016. ‚ÄúWhen you perform well, it makes people sit up and notice. There is pressure on us to do well after our performance at EURO 2016, but I‚Äôm not stressed about it. I am just going to play football at the World Cup and have fun. We can do great things if we give 100% in every match.‚Äù An Icelander in England The famous victory against England at the EURO tournament meant a lot for J√≥hann as he lived in England during his teenage years, as well as currently playing in England. ‚ÄúIt was extra sweet to beat England. Everybody in Iceland watches English football, and most support England at international tournaments.‚Äù J√≥hann was on the books of Premier League clubs Fulham and Chelsea as a youngster but suffered an injury which forced him to return to Iceland ‚ÄúI got the taste of being a professional which gave me the extra motivation to return abroad to play. I knew I had the chance after I played one season at home in 2008, and that‚Äôs when I received my first international cap as well.‚Äù J√≥hann was in England when they played at the 2006 World Cup, ‚ÄúIf you told me I would play at the World Cup twelve years later with Iceland, I would have thought you were crazy. It was, of course, a dream of mine, but I thought it would never happen.‚Äù The multitalented footballer J√≥hann Berg‚Äôs talents are not only showcased on the football field, as he is rumoured to have been a skilled player in the shooter video game Counter-Strike, ‚ÄúI played it a little bit too much at one time. I was good and enjoyed playing with my mates. Let‚Äôs just say I was not as good in Counter-Strike as I am at football.‚Äù J√≥hann recently released a football trivia game in Iceland named Beint √≠ mark, and fancies himself as a bit of a football trivia master ‚ÄúI know quite a lot about football as I both read extensively and watch a lot of games. I think I do alright.‚Äù The golden generation? Iceland has a great squad of players who play for each other, but what sets the team apart from other teams? ‚ÄúIt is very difficult to break us down defensively, so we don‚Äôt concede a lot of goals. Couple that with the fact that we always believe we can score, you‚Äôve got a great formula. We‚Äôre a difficult side to face as we‚Äôve got big men up top who can win every header.‚Äù But is the current generation a so-called ‚Äògolden generation? ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a sure thing getting such a group of footballers together, we‚Äôre incredibly lucky. Everybody is willing to run until their lungs burst and we also happen to be good footballers. It‚Äôs going to be difficult to get another generation like this, but hopefully qualifying for big tournaments becomes a habit. We need to keep the same values we have today in order to enjoy success in the future.‚Äù Facing superstars Iceland‚Äôs opening match at the World Cup is against Argentina, where the players will face off against the genius of Lionel Messi. The Icelandic team faced a similar situation at the EURO tournament when the first challengers were eventual champions Portugal, starring the world-class Cristiano Ronaldo. When asked about the phenomenal challenge of facing Lionel Messi, J√≥hann Berg remains undaunted ‚ÄúThese are two of the best footballers in the world, it would be pure joy to get a result against Argentine as we did against Portugal. These players are on another level and play a completely different brand of football than we do. We will do everything to shut down Messi just as we shut down Ronaldo.‚Äù  Heimir Hallgr√≠msson During Heimir Hallgr√≠msson‚Äôs reign as the Icelandic national team‚Äôs manager, Iceland has enjoyed unprecedented success, qualifying for the EURO 2016 and will now step on the grandest sporting stage of them all, the World Cup. By doing so, Iceland became the smallest nation ever to qualify for the tournament. Heimir‚Äôs honest approach to work and life has gained him many admirers. A testament to how beloved he is by his countrymen, a hop-heavy pale ale named Heimir has recently been specially brewed in his honour. We sat down with the charming Heimir to discuss his background in dentistry, his philosophy, and how he plans to stop Lionel Messi this summer.
